intro: Tryphane recurva, commonly known as the curling tryphane, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly curled, giving it its common name. The flowers bloom in late spring or early summer, producing small yellow to orange blossoms that attract pollinators.
